thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: South Korea says North Korea could be behind hacking into Japan's Coincheck: Channel A

author: Reuters Editorial
title: South Korea says North Korea could be behind hacking into Japan's Coincheck: Channel A
text:
February 5, 2018 / 11:45 PM / in 20 minutes South Korea says North Korea could be behind hacking into Japan's Coincheck: Channel A Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea’s spy agency has said North Korean hackers seem to be behind a recent $520 million cyber theft in Japan’s cryptocurrency exchange Coincheck, South Korea’s Channel A news said. 
“The spy agency told parliament’s intelligence committee that North Korean hackers probably had hacked into Coincheck and stole 570 billion won ($521.44 million) worth (of cryptocurrency),” the news channel reported. Reporting by Dahee Kim; Editing by Paul Tait
